headline: All Natural Strawberry Lemonade
description: This homemade strawberry lemonade is easily prepared in a blender with fresh strawberries, lemon juice, and sugar for a refreshing summer drink.
name: All Natural Strawberry Lemonade

recipeInstructions.text: Place strawberries in a blender; top with 2 tablespoons sugar. Pour 1 cup water over sugared strawberries; blend until completely smooth.
Transfer strawberry juice into a large pitcher; stir in remaining 6 cups water, lemon juice, and 1 cup sugar until well blended. Chill before serving.

review.reviewBody: i thought it tasted like actual strawberry lemonade and with fresh strawberries and now making it again we will be using frozen strawberries with it
Only used 1/2 cup sugar and some extra strawberries. I don't like my lemonade really sweet so this was perfect. Recommend tasting as you go! Also used frozen strawberries and was fine.
Very good, simple recipe. Definitely recommend. Just completed first batch and still sampling. Rating may go up, and definitely won't fall below a 4-star rating.
Excellent recipe. I doubled the recipe for a party. I added 4 extra strawberries to bump up the flavor a little, otherwise perfect as written.
Taste was very natural and tasty, thanks for a quick recipe

I loved this drink; before starting I read the reviews and followed a reviewer’s tip of adding 1/4 cup of sugar when blending the strawberries and oh my it is so good. I made it with only 400 ml of lemon juice and 5 cups of water as that’s all I could fit in my jug but I believe it’s the right amount of juice to have a sweet taste without that bitterness.
I think it was really good!
I used some Agave, too
I am new to homemade drinks, but this was really great! I made it exactly to the recipe and it turned out amazing. I have a low sugar tolerance but it definitely wasn't too sweet at all.

This is a refreshingly delightful strawberry lemonade. I decided to make a sugar syrup, however, by simmering 1 cup sugar with 1 1/2 cup water - just until the sugar dissolves. Adding ice to the syrup quickens the cooling.process, and the rest of the ingredients combine beautifully.

I can't praise this recipe enough! So simple and a welcome idea for those whose strawberries are running over... it needs no improvements. Be aware of how much you are making; the entire container was demolished by 4 people who were trying to be polite and not drink as much as they would have liked. I wish I had doubled it because it stays wonderful stored in the pitcher for multiple days (as I found out on my second time making it without the hungry foursome)!
I absolutely fell in love with this recipe I make it for my grandchildren they love it.. it's very refreshing . I will never buy store strawberry lemonade again. I made it exactly as this recipe

Made as is, you can tell it needs something. I've learned it helps to make a simple syrup by combining the sugar and equal part water then heat up to dissolve the sugar & allow to cool (for this recipe of 2 cups lemon juice, I used 1.5 cups sugar + 1.5 cups water). I did add nearly twice as many strawberries and 2 extra tbsp sugar because my strawberries weren't super sweet - keep that in mind when making strawberry lemonade :) And personal preference. I then added an additional 5 cups water (instead of 6). Start smaller - you can always add more, and keep in mind you may be adding ice.
Needed way more sugar and water. I ended up using a pound of strawberries, 3 cups of sugar total and 11 cups of water total. After that it was delicious!

This recipe is great! 
Just added 1 1/2 cup of lemon juice instead of 2 cups. Turned out perfect. The whole family said this is the best strawberry lemonade I've made.

I added more strawberries, roughly double the amount, which I would highly recommend to get a stronger flavour.
Could probably do with less sugar, but that depends on the sweetness of your strawberries I suppose. 
To get more juice out of my lemons I microwave them for 30 seconds - one decent size lemon should get you 1/4 cup of lemon juice if you do that! 
If you have a large enough blender then I would recommend mixing it in the blender not just stirring it as the recipe suggests because it makes the sugar dissolve a lot easier. 
I'm going to try it another time with sparkling water and I think it would be lovely!
OMG am 14yrl aand this is my first lemonade! i have made my first lemonade everyone!!! YAYAYAYAYA
I made this with raspberrys instead of strawberries because I didn't have eny and it turned out amazing
I did add a whole batch of strawberries, 12 lemons (a little over 2 cups). I also did this same recipe with raspberries & turned out great.
Delicious!

I had some store bought lemonade I didn’t like so I used parts of this recipe to perk it up. I used 7-9 strawberries cut in half with about 3 tbsp sugar and instead of water I used 1 cup of the lemonade. I whirred this all together in the blender until we’ll blended. Then I added the rest of the liquid as lemonade. This made my so so lemonade taste delicious.
Taste absolutely delicious How many Strawberries and lemon used definitely depends on the size of the fruit. I prefer more tart but you can always add more sugar. Simple
it was good
It's hot outside. This was today's refreshment delicious! Tonight...I might add a lil' vodka.
Sooo good on a hot summer day!
Incredibly good
it really just tasted like stwarberrys and water so I added a BUNCH of sugar and I taste no lemon
I used half of the lemon juice. Wonderful blend of Strawberry and Lemon. Great Flavor.
Delicious! We loved every drop!
It turned out great thank you for sharing this.

This was delicious, refreshing and way better than any strawberry lemonade I used to buy in a store. I love how I can use old strawberries that none of us would use anymore because they look bad (not moldy though, of course), blend them up with sugar and have an awesome tasting lemonade.
Good
I made this according to the recipe and agreed
Will make again, for sure!
This is a really great beverage to make. It was very easy and it turned out amazing.

I used 13 strawberries because that's how many I had (and strained the little seeds after blending)...it's really good by itself, but I had some friends over and added vodka...makes a great cocktail, too!
Definitely loved it.
This recipe is delicious. I made it cause i dont drink soda and i love it. Its not too sweet. I will definitely be making it again.

I added a few more strawberries than the recipe calls for, only because they were small. 
It's very good, always gone quickly after it's made
It turned out really good WOW A+ for that

Super simple and quick to make! I would suggest using warm-hot water to dissolve the sugar faster. Then refrigerate after. Also, i would definitely add more strawberries than you think you need and possibly even more lemon juice! But overall a very good recipe!
great
It was fun making it and I would recommend it to friends.
I had to make a partial batch the first time. I takes 3 pounds of lemons to get 2 cups of juice. We always go easy on the sugar
Me and all of my family loved this!!!
It's a delicious drink
a little tart
It was very simple to make, but it was SO bitter! You can't taste the strawberries either. I had to add an extra cup of sugar and 7 more cups of water. I would not make it again.
This was a great recipe I would just add half the lemon juice because if I would of added more it would be super tart
I made no changes, and it was awesome
This turned out great! Substituted 1/3 Cup powdered Stevia for sugar. Puréed strawberries and two lemons (peeled) in a Vitamix
I did blueberries instead of strawberries it was so good !!!!
I added the last cup of sugar in 1/4 cup increments but the recipe was fairly close and it was very good.
I added lemon slices
I confess I did add rum to mine......Would be good with a mint garnish, or use tequila and limes instead for strawberry margarita.

An excellent drink!! I used a sieve to strain the strawberries So that there wasn't a whole bunch of seeds in my drink. I added an extra cup of water to be able to fill my container. I taste-tested the drink before and after I added water. I didn't taste much difference I think the only difference would be it will be less sugar. I'm sure I will drink this more than just in the summer. It's very refreshing.
Super delish as is
Didn't blend strawberries completely because i like having strawberry chunks in mine

Love the recipe! Just made a few changes like adding more strawberries and sprinkling them with a little sugar to pull out the natural juices. Also made a simple syrup to sweeten it a bit. Will make this a regular, will also try with raspberries.
This lemonade was so delicious! It only lasted one day! I used a little more strawberries but only because they were going bad. Wouldn’t change a thing. Great recipe.
Sooo good. Maybe add some spirits for a refreshing cocktail at a party...
delicious!
This was gross! Couldn’t taste strawberries or lemons! Tasted like water with chunks. We put 10 lemons in and still didn’t get a good taste based on what the recipe said to do. This sucked!
Great and easy recipe. Cheesecake Factory has nothing on this!!!!

I made it for my family with a bbq dinner and it was great! It didn't take as long to make as I thought and I squeezed the lemons with a handheld device. If I was in a hurry O'd consider using store bought lemon juice from a bottle as it may be a little faster to make it that way. If you're looking for a nice treat for your friends and family then try this recipe for strawberry lemonade!

We used a couple more strawberries than called for, and liquefied them with the water and sugar in our Bullet blender.
We used about 1 1/2 cups or so of lemon juice, because that's how much juice we got from our lemons. We spun the juice and pulp in the Bullet, also.
Except for a bit less lemon juice, followed the recipe, and it was delicious; I don't think I would want any more lemon than we had.
 Made 2 quarts.
Very, very tasty.
I increased the amount of lemon juice to 2.5 cups and added 3/4 cups of sugar instead of the full cup. This created a nice tart lemonade that still was sweet.
IT was good, but I had to add 2 more lemons for the full lemonade flavor, it tasted way too watery, and I added a few extra strawberries because who doesn't love strawberries.
Best strawberry lemonade. I will definitely make it again.
I always have strawberry lemonade when my family visits Chili's restaurants in the USA. Made this and everyone in my family agrees that this is close enough to fill in the gaps between visits.

I tried this with sugar substitute and it didn't work for me. rating in the middle because i did make that change. also, not too much strawberry flavor. Maybe i need to use mega size strawberries??? My hunt for my strawberry lemonade recipe continues.
Excellent!!!! I tend to overdo the strawberries and cut back on the refined sugar, looooooove so much

I made a double batch for the Fourth of July and put it in a beverage dispenser. I used a lot more strawberries and a little more sugar because it seems that strawberries are not as sweet as they used to be. They are very tart. It was a hit. The only problem I had was that about half way through I had to put a ladle in the dispenser because the pulp clogged the spout. There was a lot of pulp from the strawberries I had liquified in the blender. Next time I might strain it first. Two thumbs up from me ??

Never really been good at making smoothies even though I follow directions so wasn't sure how lemonade would turn out. I used a whole plastic bin of strawberries ( what my husband didn't eat the night before but a little more than 8 medium sized ) followed the measurements of the recipe otherwise and this was perfect. Everyone loved it! Nice combo of tart and sweet. Very easy to make, will do again and again.
Was a little too tart for us. I added a little more sugar and strawberries.
Looked good, but I did not like the taste or texture. Think I'll go totally off recipe if I make it again.
I liked it but i think there was way too much lemon juice, Maybe lay off about 3 cups of lemon juice, and maybe add more water, other than that it was ok
Delicious. I wish I could have found my meshusband strainer though it did have some strawberry seeds/pulp.

I used this as a base line for my first attempt. I only wanted one glass full so I divided it all up very roughly... I ended up with a little more than needed and let my friend try it :P

I added way more strawberries than suggested - about 7 smallish strawberries, half a cup of lemon juice and a cup and a half of water along with 2 tablespoons of sugar... I could have put less sugar in probably...
A mixture of sweetness and tart! Delicious! Texture is amazing, it is a perfect drink for the summer! Way better than something that I would buy at the grocery store! Would totally recommend!!
Awesome I'll make this all the time

Super easy to make. I only used 1 cup of lemon juice as that's all I had and I used 1/2 cup sugar to start with. Way too sweet for me. I stopped at the 1/2 cup sugar. I did add more strawberries for a stronger color and flavor. My husband gave it a 10 ( he does have a sweeter tooth than I) I left it to his taste and added water to my cup and it was perfect.
More berries and less sugar. But a very tasty drink.
Extremely easy to make. Children love the pretty pink color, and both children and adults love the taste.
Sooooo easy to make. It uses everyday simple things. I could never get tired of this.
Too tart for my liking, I added another cup of water and a few 4 more tablespoons of sugar (I also halved the recipe since my pitcher holds only so much).
I made a half batch as a trial run before a birthday party and it is a hit! I did use 8 frozen organic strawberries in the half batch, and I recommend doubling the berries. It was wonderful.
Fantastic! My 13-year old daughter made this. It was easy and delicious.

This is refreshing and tasty. The strawberries add nice color and flavor. I made a simple syrup with the sugar and 1 cup of the water before adding it in. The final mixture was very strong - it needed over two cups of additional water to get to the right strength.
Very tasty! Will definitely make this again!
I had to add in three more strawberries because it was too tart. other than that though it was good.
Delicious and very refreshing! The flavor was perfect and our children devoured it. This reminds me of the strawberry lemonade that they make in the steakhouse restaurants. Yum.
This recipe is delicious. I did do as some other reviewers did and added a few more strawberries and 2 tbs more sugar when puréeing the strawberries. I'll definitely make again.
Wonderful! Flavor. It's a keeper
great !!! but use real lemons , and i added ice for a different texture !!!!
Incredibly simple and delicious! Easy to add vodka to for an adult beverage. Made it for family I was entertaining and they were begging for more of it a couple days later!
I added a bit more sugar. It was a hit!
Instead of sugar I added sweet and low. Next time I'll add more strawberries and maybe more lemon juice (Ps: it takes about 15 different size lemons to get 2 cups of juice.
